author: tbenr
content:
Hey mates.
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4807  introduced `is_proposer_equivocation` . I understand the intent but i have concerns on how it translates in practice in clients code.
There is a clear interaction with gossip rules which already deal with equivocation and makes not possibile in practice to have equivocating blocks on slot N in the store when it is time to propose slot N+1.
Thus I believe that check should be based on gossip rules data structures rather than store. Which opens a testability issue: reference tests based on the current spec will fail on clients, and the actual path wont be tested (cose IIRC gossip rules are not covered by reference tests).

WDYT?
